content:
LdapConnection Class

In this Article

The LdapConnection class creates a TCP/IP or UDP LDAP connection to Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services or an LDAP server.

Syntax

Declaration

public class LdapConnection : System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection, IDisposable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection
  • LdapConnection

Inherited Members

ClientCertificates
,
Directory
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

If the ClientCertificates property on the LdapConnection object and QueryClientCertificate property on the LdapSessionOptions object are both set, the certificate specified in the ClientCertificates property is ignored.

Constructors summary

LdapConnection(LdapDirectoryIdentifier)

The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified directory identifier. The logon credentials and the Negotiate Authentication are used to connect to the LDAP server.
LdapConnection(String)

The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified server.
LdapConnection(LdapDirectoryIdentifier,NetworkCredential)

The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified directory identifier and network credentials. Negotiate Authentication is used.
LdapConnection(LdapDirectoryIdentifier,NetworkCredential,AuthType)

The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified directory identifier, network credentials, and authentication type.

Properties summary

AuthType

The AuthType property contains the supported authentication types.
AutoBind

The AutoBind property specifies whether an automatic bind is allowed.
Credential

The Credential property contains the network credentials for the object.
SessionOptions

The SessionOptions property contains an LdapSessionOptions object that specifies the session options.
Timeout

The Timeout property contains the length of time, in seconds, before the LdapConnection times out.

Methods summary

Abort(IAsyncResult)

The Abort method cancels the asynchronous request.
BeginSendRequest(DirectoryRequest,PartialResultProcessing,AsyncCallback,Object)

The BeginSendRequest method sends data asynchronously to the server.
BeginSendRequest(DirectoryRequest,TimeSpan,PartialResultProcessing,AsyncCallback,Object)

The BeginSendRequest method sends data asynchronously to the server.
Bind()

The Bind method sends an LDAP bind using the current credentials.
Bind(NetworkCredential)

The Bind method sends an LDAP bind using the specified NetworkCredential.
Dispose()

The Dispose method closes and releases the LDAP handle.
Dispose(Boolean)

The Dispose method closes the connection and optionally releases the LDAP handle.
EndSendRequest(IAsyncResult)

The EndSendRequest method completes an asynchronous request.
Finalize()

The Finalize method allows an LdapConnection object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the LdapConnection object is reclaimed by garbage collection.
GetPartialResults(IAsyncResult)

The GetPartialResults method retrieves partial results of an asynchronous operation.
SendRequest(DirectoryRequest)

The SendRequest method sends a single DirectoryRequest as an LDAP v3 operation.
SendRequest(DirectoryRequest,TimeSpan)

The SendRequest method sends a single DirectoryRequest as an LDAP v3 operation.

Constructors

  • LdapConnection(LdapDirectoryIdentifier)

    The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified directory identifier. The logon credentials and the Negotiate Authentication are used to connect to the LDAP server.

    public LdapConnection (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier identifier);

    Parameters

    • identifier
      LdapDirectoryIdentifier

      An LdapDirectoryIdentifier object that specifies the server.

    Exceptions

    • LdapException

      Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

  • LdapConnection(String)

    The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified server.

    public LdapConnection (string server);

    Parameters

    • server
      String

      A string specifying the server which can be a domain name, LDAP server name or dotted strings representing the IP address of the LDAP server. Optionally, this parameter may also include a port number, separated from the right end of the string by a colon (:).

    Exceptions

    • LdapException

      Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

  • LdapConnection(LdapDirectoryIdentifier,NetworkCredential)

    The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified directory identifier and network credentials. Negotiate Authentication is used.

    public LdapConnection (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier identifier, System.Net.NetworkCredential credential);

    Parameters

    • identifier
      LdapDirectoryIdentifier

      An LdapDirectoryIdentifier object that specifies the server.

    • credential
      NetworkCredential

      A NetworkCredential object that specifies the credentials to use.

    Exceptions

    • LdapException

      Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

  • LdapConnection(LdapDirectoryIdentifier,NetworkCredential,AuthType)

    The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the LdapConnection class using the specified directory identifier, network credentials, and authentication type.

    public LdapConnection (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier identifier, System.Net.NetworkCredential credential, System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType authType);

    Parameters

    • identifier
      LdapDirectoryIdentifier

      An LdapDirectoryIdentifier object that specifies the server.

    • credential
      NetworkCredential

      A NetworkCredential object that specifies the credentials to use.

    • authType
      AuthType

      A AuthType values that specifies the type of authentication to use.

    Exceptions

    • LdapException

      Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

    • InvalidEnumArgumentException

      Thrown when authType is out of range.

    • ArgumentException

      Thrown when authType is specified as Anonymous but credential specified credentials.

Properties

  • AuthType

    The AuthType property contains the supported authentication types.

    public System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType AuthType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • AuthType

      A supported authentication type.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidEnumArgumentException

      Thrown when authType is out of range.

  • AutoBind

    The AutoBind property specifies whether an automatic bind is allowed.

    public bool AutoBind { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the automatic bind is allowed; otherwise, false.

  • Credential

    The Credential property contains the network credentials for the object.

    public override System.Net.NetworkCredential Credential { set; }

    Property Value

    • NetworkCredential

      The network credentials for the object.

  • SessionOptions

    The SessionOptions property contains an LdapSessionOptions object that specifies the session options.

    public System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions SessionOptions { get; }

    Property Value

    • LdapSessionOptions

      An LdapSessionOptions object that specifies the session options.

    Remarks

    If the ClientCertificates property on the LdapConnection object and QueryClientCertificate property on the LdapSessionOptions object are both set, the certificate specified in the ClientCertificates property is ignored.

  • Timeout

    The Timeout property contains the length of time, in seconds, before the LdapConnection times out.

    public override TimeSpan Timeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      The length of time, in seconds, before the LdapConnection times out.

Methods

  • Abort(IAsyncResult)

    The Abort method cancels the asynchronous request.

    public void Abort (IAsyncResult asyncResult);

    Parameters

    • asyncResult
      IAsyncResult

      A IAsyncResult object that references the asynchronous request.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object handle is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      asyncResult is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentException

      Thrown if asyncResult was not returned by the corresponding call to stem.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.BeginSendRequest*

  • BeginSendRequest(DirectoryRequest,PartialResultProcessing,AsyncCallback,Object)

    The BeginSendRequest method sends data asynchronously to the server.

    public IAsyncResult BeginSendRequest (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest request, System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing partialMode, AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • request
      DirectoryRequest

      A DirectoryRequest object.

    • partialMode
      PartialResultProcessing

      A value from PartialResultProcessing enumeration that specifies the level of partial result to return.

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback function.

    • state
      Object

      An Object that contains the state data for this request.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      A IAsyncResult object that references the asynchronous send.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object handle is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      request is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • NotSupportedException

      Partial results are not supported.

    • ArgumentException

      A callback function must be specified if partialMode is equal to PartialResultProcessing.

  • BeginSendRequest(DirectoryRequest,TimeSpan,PartialResultProcessing,AsyncCallback,Object)

    The BeginSendRequest method sends data asynchronously to the server.

    public IAsyncResult BeginSendRequest (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest request, TimeSpan requestTimeout, System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing partialMode, AsyncCallback callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • request
      DirectoryRequest

      A DirectoryRequest object.

    • requestTimeout
      TimeSpan

      The time, in seconds, until the request times out.

    • partialMode
      PartialResultProcessing

      A value from PartialResultProcessing enumeration that specifies the level of partial result to return.

    • callback
      AsyncCallback

      The AsyncCallback function.

    • state
      Object

      An Object that contains the state data for this request.

    Returns

    • IAsyncResult

      A IAsyncResult object that references the asynchronous send.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object handle is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      request is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • NotSupportedException

      Partial results are not supported.

    • ArgumentException

      A callback function must be specified if partialMode is equal to PartialResultProcessing.

  • Bind()

    The Bind method sends an LDAP bind using the current credentials.

    public void Bind ();

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object handle is not valid.

    • LdapException

      The error code returned by LDAP does not map to one of the ResultCode enumeration error codes.

    • InvalidOperationException

      Either the stem.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates* property specifies more than one client certificate to send for authentication, or the stem.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AuthType* property is Anonymous and one or more credentials are supplied.

  • Bind(NetworkCredential)

    The Bind method sends an LDAP bind using the specified NetworkCredential.

    public void Bind (System.Net.NetworkCredential newCredential);

    Parameters

    • newCredential
      NetworkCredential

      A NetworkCredential object that specifies the credentials to use.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object handle is not valid.

    • LdapException

      The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a ResultCode enumeration error code.

    • InvalidOperationException

      Either the stem.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates* property specifies more than one client certificate to send for authentication, or the stem.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AuthType* property is Anonymous and one or more credentials are supplied.

  • Dispose()

    The Dispose method closes and releases the LDAP handle.

    public void Dispose ();
  • Dispose(Boolean)

    The Dispose method closes the connection and optionally releases the LDAP handle.

    protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true if the handle is released when the connection is closed or false if the connection is closed without releasing the handle.

  • EndSendRequest(IAsyncResult)

    The EndSendRequest method completes an asynchronous request.

    public System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse EndSendRequest (IAsyncResult asyncResult);

    Parameters

    • asyncResult
      IAsyncResult

      An IAsyncResult object that contains state data for this request.

    Returns

    • DirectoryResponse

      A DirectoryResponse object that contains the results of the request.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      Thrown if the object is already disposed. The object handle is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      asyncResult is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentException

      asyncResult does not match the asyncResult returned in the stem.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.BeginSendRequest* call.

    • LdapException

      The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a ResultCode enumeration error code.

    • DirectoryOperationException

      Thrown if the server returned a DirectoryResponse object with an error.

  • Finalize()

    The Finalize method allows an LdapConnection object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the LdapConnection object is reclaimed by garbage collection.

    ~LdapConnection ();
  • GetPartialResults(IAsyncResult)

    The GetPartialResults method retrieves partial results of an asynchronous operation.

    public System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultsCollection GetPartialResults (IAsyncResult asyncResult);

    Parameters

    • asyncResult
      IAsyncResult

      An IAsyncResult object that contains state data for this request.

    Returns

    • PartialResultsCollection

      A PartialResultsCollection object that contains the partial results.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object is already disposed. The object handle is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      asyncResult is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • ArgumentException

      asyncResult does not match the asyncResult returned in the stem.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.BeginSendRequest* call.

    • LdapException

      The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a ResultCode enumeration error code.

    • DirectoryOperationException

      Thrown if the server returned a DirectoryResponse object with an error.

  • SendRequest(DirectoryRequest)

    The SendRequest method sends a single DirectoryRequest as an LDAP v3 operation.

    public override System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse SendRequest (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest request);

    Parameters

    • request
      DirectoryRequest

      A DirectoryRequest object that contains the request.

    Returns

    • DirectoryResponse

      A DirectoryResponse object that contains the response from the server.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object is already disposed. The object handle is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      asyncResult is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • NotSupportedException

      Request is of type DsmlAuthRequest.

    • LdapException

      The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a ResultCode enumeration error code.

    • DirectoryOperationException

      Thrown if the server returned a DirectoryResponse object with an error.

  • SendRequest(DirectoryRequest,TimeSpan)

    The SendRequest method sends a single DirectoryRequest as an LDAP v3 operation.

    public System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse SendRequest (System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest request, TimeSpan requestTimeout);

    Parameters

    • request
      DirectoryRequest

      A DirectoryRequest object that contains the request.

    • requestTimeout
      TimeSpan

      The length of time, in seconds, until the request times out.

    Returns

    • DirectoryResponse

      A DirectoryResponse object that contains the response from the server.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object is already disposed. The object handle is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      asyncResult is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

    • NotSupportedException

      Request is of type DsmlAuthRequest.

    • LdapException

      The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a the ResultCode enumeration error code.

    • DirectoryOperationException

      Thrown if the server returned a DirectoryResponse object with an error.
